title: Are there examples in history, where politicians ignored the 'will of the people' for the good of the country? - Quora

response.answer_text: I can think of numerous examples - but will instead give a contrary answer- where the “will of the people” led to disaster that could have been averted through leadership. Giving people what they want isn’t leadership, it is populism. Convincing people that what they think they want isn’t really in their (or their nation’s) best interest, and instead convincing them of a different and more productive course of action, is the essence of leadership. There was an incident at sea between Rome and Tarentum. Rome sent envoys to work things out. A statesman could have informed the people of Tarentum that they would be fools to provoke Rome. But Tarentum was a democracy, not a Republic. The people were allowed to abuse the Roman envoys - including a man who voided his bowels on the toga of the lead envoy. The envoy wore the soiled toga to the Roman Senate. The Tarentines were defeated - they had to pull their walls down- and pay tribute, and swear to be a “Friend to Rome”.

Peter the Great understood it was the economy stupid and paid no attention to the will of the people in his quest to get a port and foreign merchants to trade there. In 1700 this was the key to export and import wealth. Lincoln said that slavery was so immoral that the people’ will did not matter on this. Then we all know Trump takes pride in serving his extreme right wing conservatives while pissing off everyone else. I suppose this counts if you think he has a grand plan.

To answer this, one has to understand what is meant by the “good of the country” in the context of which political side defines what is “good.” Obviously, Brennen, Clapper, Comey, McCabe, Strzok, both Ohrs, to name a few, do not have the same sense of “good” as do most middle Americans.

In 1904, there was a six day period of civil strive in Rio de Janeiro where 30 people died, 900 were arrested and 450 were forcibly moved to the end of the world (AKA Acre). The reason of the popular revolt? Obligatory vaccination against smallpox.
Almost all actions of politicians fit this criteria. Tarrifs, trade wars, military wars, regulations, laws, etc.. they all harm innocents in the countr solely for the good of politicians.
